column4: I cant seem to get my install of ubuntu 7.04 to connect to the internet.  Neither my onboard ethernet port (marvel 88e8001) nor my pci ethernet card (Realtek rtl8139) will connect.  Anyone know why this is?  I have my ifconfig pasted here : http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/40389/
how did you try to connect? dhcp?
and what command did you use?
what steps did you take to try connecting the card
i have tried ifdown and ifup
try "dhclient eth0" and see what it says (or try with eth1 if that's the card you want)
here is the result from dhclient that i did yesterday : http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/40395/
you sure there's a dhcp server listening?
i take it this card is plugged into a cable modem or so?
yeah its plugged into the cable modem, in that paste the modem was plugged into eth0, nothing was plugged into eth1
might try looking at your cable modem logs, if you can get to them. does the link work under windows?
yeah, that's a good point. if you've switched cards, some modems get confused by the new MAC

: as far as whether or not DHCP server is listening?  I have no idea as i dont know much about this stuff, i dont this its a prob with the modem as i am using the same cable right now, just switching it back and forth from computer to computer when needed
ah, then try MasterShrek's suggestion. bet your modem is confused by the changed card
: sorry I missed MasterShrek's suggestion and I cant seem to find it
